articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Humeyra Pamuk, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Hamas has seen about half its forces wiped out in eight months of war and is relying on hit-and-run insurgent tactics to frustrate Israel's attempts to take control of Gaza, U.S. and Israeli officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Diminished Hamas switches to full insurgent mode in Gaza

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel targeted a Gaza school on Thursday that it said contained an Hamas compound, killing fighters involved in the Oct. 7 attack that sparked the eight-month war, but Gaza media said the strike killed at least 27 people seeking shelter.
articles.title: Israel says jets strike school containing Hamas compound, Gaza media says 27 killed

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that the West was wrong to assume that Moscow would never use nuclear weapons and said that he was considering deploying conventional missiles in striking distance of the United States and its allies.
articles.title: Putin says West is wrong to assume Russia would never use nuclear weapons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dutch nationalist Geert Wilders looked set for new electoral gains on Thursday as the Netherlands kicks off four days of voting in the European Parliament election held across the 27 EU member states.
articles.title: Dutch nationalist Wilders eyes win as Netherlands kicks off EU voting

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, John Irish, Ingrid Melander
articles.description: Veterans and world leaders meet in Normandy on Thursday to mark the 80th anniversary of the June 6, 1944 D-Day landings, when more than 150,000 Allied soldiers arrived in France by sea and air to drive out the forces of Nazi Germany.
articles.title: World leaders, veterans, commemorate D-Day's 80th anniversary in Normandy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department has approved the sale to Taiwan of F-16 fighter jet spare and repair parts for an estimated $80 million, the Pentagon's Defense Security Cooperation Agency said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US approves sale of F-16 parts to Taiwan for $80 mln

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: UNICEF said on Thursday that nine out of 10 children in Gaza could not eat nutrients from enough food groups to ensure their healthy growth and development.
articles.title: UNICEF finds 90% of Gazan children lack food needed for proper growth

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam real estate tycoon Truong My Lan, sentenced to death in the country's largest-ever financial fraud case, had illegally transferred money abroad, according to police, with state media on Thursday reporting $4.5 billion had been moved.
articles.title: Vietnam tycoon on death row for massive fraud illegally moved money overseas, police say

articles.author: Rishika Sadam, Sarita Singh, Manoj Kumar
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's National Democratic Alliance (NDA) formally named him on Wednesday to lead a new coalition government for a third straight term, a day after it regained power with a surprisingly slim majority.
articles.title: Modi set to take oath for the third time on June 8 as allies pledge support

articles.author: Daniel Trotta
articles.description: Jessica Leon, an asylum-seeker from Ecuador, scaled a border wall on Tuesday with her 3-year-old daughter, setting foot on U.S. soil in San Diego, California, just hours before a new asylum ban took effect.
articles.title: New reality for migrants at U.S.-Mexico border as Biden asylum ban takes effect
